page.title: 18The Old School in Haddenham
page.content: The old St. Mary's school was built in {1870.}It had 2 classrooms and a bell at the top of the school. The playground was very small with high walls all around. The girls used to play{skipping and hopscotch.}The toilets were outside. In those days the teachers were very strict and{classes had about 60 {children.}They had to write on{slates which was very hard. There was{no electric light until {1932.}Sometimes children would have to stand in the corner with a dunce's cap on their head. The children had{maths and{english}lessons and the girls used to{mend clothes for people}in the village.
